org.jvnet.hk2.component
Interface ResourceManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
InMemoryResourceManager
public interface ResourceManager

A resource manager is responsible for adding and retrieving resource from a backing store.

ResourceManager must be thread-safe. Multiple threads may concurrently execute various methods of a single ResourceManager instance.

Method Summary
<T> void
add(ResourceLocator<T> resourceInfo, T value)
          Adds a new resource to this manager, using the Extract instance information to qualify the resource, null if the resource is not qualified.
<T> T
lookup(ResourceLocator<T> resourceInfo)
          Looks up a previously stored instance of the provided type, further identifying the requested resource using the Inject meta data about it.
<T> java.util.Collection<? extends T>
lookupAll(java.lang.Class<T> type)
          Returns all previously stored instances of a particular type, null if none were registered.
 void remove(java.lang.Object value)
          Removes a resource from this manager.
 

Method Detail

add

<T> void add(ResourceLocator<T> resourceInfo,
             T value)
Adds a new resource to this manager, using the Extract instance information to qualify the resource, null if the resource is not qualified.

Parameters:
resourceInfo - is the locator information for that resource
value - new value to add to this resource manager

lookup

<T> T lookup(ResourceLocator<T> resourceInfo)
Looks up a previously stored instance of the provided type, further identifying the requested resource using the Inject meta data about it. If no qualification of the resource is provided and there is more than one instance of the provided type stored in this manager, the last entry will be returned.

Parameters:
resourceInfo - is the locator information for that resource
Returns:
the instance if found, null otherwise.

lookupAll

<T> java.util.Collection<? extends T> lookupAll(java.lang.Class<T> type)
Returns all previously stored instances of a particular type, null if none were registered.

Parameters:
type - of the resources looked up
Returns:
Can be empty but never null.

remove

void remove(java.lang.Object value)
Removes a resource from this manager.

Parameters:
value - of the resource to be removed
